description: Legal research and docket monitoring tools using CourtListener API

kentucky_courts.ked: U.S. District Court, Eastern District of Kentucky
kentucky_courts.kwd: U.S. District Court, Western District of Kentucky
kentucky_courts.ca6: U.S. Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit

tools.name: search_case_law
tools.description: Search CourtListener for legal opinions by keyword, court, date range, and precedential status. Primary tool for legal research when writing briefs or responding to motions.
tools.usage: python /Tools/legal_research/search_case_law.py "query" [--courts COURTS] [--after DATE] [--before DATE] [--precedential] [--order ORDER] [--limit N]
when_to_use: Research legal precedent for motions and briefs
Find Kentucky case law on specific issues
Search federal cases in E.D. Ky, W.D. Ky, 6th Circuit
Build citation support for legal arguments
Find recent rulings on legal issues

tools.name: explore_citations
tools.description: Navigate citation networks to find cases citing a given opinion and cases cited by that opinion. Essential for building comprehensive legal research around key precedents.
tools.usage: python /Tools/legal_research/explore_citations.py CLUSTER_ID [--depth N] [--limit N] OR python /Tools/legal_research/explore_citations.py --citation "123 F.3d 456"
when_to_use: Find cases that cite a key precedent (Shepardizing)
Discover what cases an opinion relies on
Build citation network for comprehensive research
Find related cases through citation relationships
Track how precedent has been applied/distinguished

tools.name: get_opinion_full_text
tools.description: Retrieve the complete text and metadata for a specific opinion. Get full opinion after finding it via search.
when_to_use: Read full opinion after finding via search
Quote exact language from opinion for brief
Save opinion to case file
Analyze opinion content in detail
Extract specific holding or reasoning

tools.name: find_my_cases
tools.description: Find all dockets where a specific attorney is listed. Track your own cases across multiple courts.
when_to_use: Find all your cases in federal court
Track cases where you're attorney of record
Get list of open cases across multiple courts
Monitor case status changes
Build case list for reporting
tools.note: Best coverage for federal courts (PACER). State court coverage limited.

tools.name: get_docket_details
tools.description: Get complete docket information including all filings, parties, and dates. Full docket sheet for a case.
when_to_use: Get full docket sheet with all filings
Review case history and timeline
Check for upcoming hearings/deadlines
Identify parties and attorneys
Download complete case record

tools.name: monitor_upcoming_dates
tools.description: Monitor upcoming court dates, hearings, and deadlines across multiple cases. Calendar management and deadline tracking.
tools.usage: python /Tools/legal_research/monitor_upcoming_dates.py --attorney "Name" [--days N] OR python /Tools/legal_research/monitor_upcoming_dates.py --dockets IDs [--days N]
when_to_use: Calendar management across multiple cases
Deadline tracking and monitoring
Find upcoming hearings for next 30/60/90 days
Trial preparation scheduling
Avoid missing court dates
tools.note: Extracts dates from docket entries. Real-time court calendars may not be comprehensive.

tools.name: oral_arguments_search
tools.description: Search appellate court oral arguments with automatic speech-to-text transcription. Essential for analyzing attorney performance, reviewing appellate strategy, and understanding judicial questioning patterns.
when_to_use: Analyze attorney performance and argumentation strategies
Review successful appellate arguments
Understand judicial questioning patterns
Prepare for oral arguments (study similar cases)
Find precedent on specific legal arguments
Research how courts handle evidentiary issues
Cross-examination preparation (opposing counsel analysis)
tools.high_value_feature: Auto-generated transcripts eliminate need for manual listening/transcription
